revised_title: Analysis of British and Foreign Salt Varieties for Economic Purposes
tldr: The author examines various types of British and foreign salt, focusing on their chemical composition and fitness for different economic purposes. The study reveals that Cheshire salt is nearly free of impurities and has a higher purity level compared to foreign bay-salts. The author also investigates the mechanical properties of salt crystals, such as their size and compactness, which affect their ability to preserve animal food.
